reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Etisal Assiut Association for Information Technology/Empowerment of disabled women through technology

description.narrative: Etisal Assiut Association for information technology has contributed to introduce hundreds of job opportunities and a significant increase in the income of young people through the first employment forum held by the Association in the technological zone in new Assiut. Association member companies have introduced job opportunities and received the necessary funding from under the umbrella of the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology. These successes gave young people their first jobs that are often the only source of family income. Despite this progress we want more opportunities for a sustainable economy and entrepreneurship for the most disadvantaged groups in rural areas especially girls with disabilities who are coping with daily challenge s and society view of dealing with them and marginalization that prevent them from achieving themselves and participating effectively at promoting their societies especially we have become in a great technical world that does not adhere to limits. Etisal Assiut aims to help women and girls with disabilities in 11 districts to achieve the financial independence of starting their small projects at their homes to promote them and ensure the sustainability through the use of ICTs. The association will achieve this by helping girls and women to join the labor market - increasing the income of girls and women involved in the action and raising awareness among the community about the importance of economically empowering disabled women.

Etisal Assiut Association for information technology has contributed to introduce hundreds of job opportunities and a significant increase in the income of young people through the first employment forum held by the Association in the technological zone in new Assiut. Association member companies have introduced job opportunities and received the necessary funding from under the umbrella of the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology. These successes gave young people their first jobs that are often the only source of family income. Despite this progress we want more opportunities for a sustainable economy and entrepreneurship for the most disadvantaged groups in rural areas especially girls with disabilities who are coping with daily challenge s and society view of dealing with them and marginalization that prevent them from achieving themselves and participating effectively at promoting their societies especially we have become in a great technical world that does not adhere to limits. Etisal Assiut aims to help women and girls with disabilities in 11 districts to achieve the financial independence of starting their small projects at their homes to promote them and ensure the sustainability through the use of ICTs. The association will achieve this by helping girls and women to join the labor market - increasing the income of girls and women involved in the action and raising awareness among the community about the importance of economically empowering disabled women.
